title: Who Can Mediate?
summary: You may be able to mediate many different types of disputes, including those involving real estate, employment, family law, and insurance issues. Mediation eligibility can differ depending on whether the dispute resolution program requires participants to be from a certain income level or has other prerequisites such as being a homeowner or having a specific legal status. If you’re applying to a mediation program that has program-specific requirements, you might be required to sign a waiver to be exempt from paying the program’s fee.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a great way to resolve your legal dispute, but it\u2019s not right for everyone. If you\u2019re eligible to mediate, that might depend on the type of case you have and who you are. For example, there may be other requirements that you meet to qualify as an eligible candidate.
Mediation eligibility can differ depending on whether the dispute resolution program requires participants to be from a certain income level or has other prerequisites such as being a homeowner or having a specific legal status. You should also keep in mind that some programs may require mediation only when parties can\u2019t agree on a settlement and not necessarily as an initial step in their process for resolving disputes. Read on for more information about who can mediate and what factors may impact your ability to participate in this alternative dispute resolution process.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Heel
The Top 10 Greatest Cat Moments in History

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`So you think your cat is cute, and that\u2019s a wonderful thing. After all, cats are fluffy and adorable creatures who also happen to be natural stress relievers. But do you think your cat is cute enough to make it into the history books? Probably not. Sorry to burst your bubble, but even the cutest cat in the world would struggle to compete with some of these feline friends when it comes to making an impact on human history...
Cats have been a constant companion of humans for thousands of years. They\u2019re enigmatic creatures with a reputation for being aloof and independent; they don\u2019t ask for much and they keep very little as repayment. But cats demand something intangible from their owners: companionship. As a result, there are many famous cats in history whose exploits have become the stuff of legend\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Toilet Outside

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Your dog might have been house-trained as a puppy, but that doesn\u2019t mean they won\u2019t have accidents as an adult. Maybe you\u2019ve just moved to a new home and your dog hasn\u2019t gotten used to the new smells yet, or maybe he has medical issues that are causing him to have accidents. Whatever the reason, if your dog is having accidents in the house it can be distressing for both of you. However, with time and patience you can help your dog learn again how to toilet outside.
There are various reasons why a dog may stop using the indoor toilet. It may be as simple as them not liking it because of its location or smell or because there\u2019s another person or animal living in the house now who they don\u2019t like seeing when they do their business.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Mediation is a process that helps people resolve conflicts and find solutions to difficult problems. It\u2019t not the same thing as arbitration or negotiation. Mediation is a voluntary process in which a neutral third party, the mediator, assists others in exploring issues, managing conflict, and solving problems in an effort to resolve conflict and move forward. The parties involved in the dispute remain control over their own destiny at all times. They are free to walk away from mediation at any time with no consequence. The goal of mediation is not compromise but resolution. It\u2019t win-win or lose-lose but instead find a place somewhere between those two extremes where both parties can feel satisfied with the outcome of their dispute.  Mediation services are often provided by private organizations such as nonprofit community mediation centers or faith-based centers that offer these services pro bono publico, which means \u201Cfor the good of the public\u201D without charge."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos on Youtube

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: From First Date to Soulmate: How to Know If You're on the Right Track

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are so many first date horror stories out there \u2014 awkward silences, strange amateur- magician tricks, and cringe-worthy pick-up lines being just a few of them. But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stress during the Holiday Season
How to Resolve Conflicts through Mediation

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a process in which an impartial third party helps two people resolve their differences and reach an equitable solution to their conflict. The mediator doesn\u2019t take sides, but instead helps both parties understand each other\u2019s point of view. This way, the disputants can agree on a fair outcome and put an end to their disagreements.
If you are part of an organization that is going through a lot of conflict right now (or any time soon), mediation might be a good solution for reducing tensions, smoothing things over and getting everyone back on track. Here we\u2019ll explain what mediation is, why it works so well for resolving conflicts and how you can initiate it in your organization.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
